videos.title: Flower Crown Braid | Updo | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
This Crown Braid upstyle has to be a new fav!  I seriously am in love with this updo!  I love that it looks so much like a boho hairstyle but that it also can be worn by anyone at anytime! 

This braid looks complicated and because of all the braids it might take some time, but it is sure to generate a million comments!  This hairstyle is really not a hard hairstyle as it's made up of simple braids that are twisted to create each rosette.  

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHFlowerCrown

Please be sure to click the "üîî" next to the SUBSCRIBE button, to join our Notification Squad for #PowerHour each week, and leave a comment below telling me what you would like to see next!

videos.title: Infinity Braid Combo | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
Click here to see my 15 Winter Hacks video over on our new MillennialMoms channel! http://youtu.be/FY1_yV5PXaE

I had been meaning to film this hairstyle tutorial for some time now after seeing it first on @hairandnailsinspiration over a year ago.  I'd completely forgotten about it until my friend @Braidsandstyles12 recently recreated it on IG. This Dutch version of the Infinity braid has existed for awhile now, but these two individuals were my inspiration. We created a combo with it by finishing off the braid into a chunky fishtail!

Although we have done a traditional Infinity Braid before, this version adds in pieces of hair along the way more like a Dutch Braid would, which allows you to take the braid down the back of the head.  If you have thick hair, I'd suggest doing two braids, side by side, instead of one... as the infinity strand can can get super thick fast!

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHInfinityCombo

Kamri has been wearing this a lot lately, and receives so many compliments on it. Particularly because the chunky look of the infinity braid connects perfectly well with the chunky fishtail, giving a beautiful looking braid!

Please be sure to give this video a BIG "üëçüèª" if you loved it, and leave a comment below telling us what you are excited for in 2016!

üíã's -Mindy

Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, spray bottle, 1 small hair elastic, hairspray {if desired}.

Time Requirement: 7-10 minutes

Skill Level: Hard

videos.title: Dutch Loop Braid | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
Click here to watch last week's Braid Flip Combo! http://youtu.be/Fyih--KFpHQ?list=UU2LgZ_4GzSFQS-3a87_Jc6w

This week's tutorial is for the Dutch Loop Braid. It's not a new hairstyle, but is very beautiful and we wanted to learn how to do it! I've most recently seen a variation from our friend @maya_heart_hairstyles on IG. 

What I love about this Dutch Braid variation is that it looks like a Christmas wreath without being over the top. It would also be a perfect braid for Breast Cancer Awareness, since it also takes the shape of a ribbon. 

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHDutchLoopBraid

I categorize this style has hard only because of the way you have to wrap and cross the braids in back. This hairstyle is perfect for sports, dance, and gymnastics as it keeps your hair back tight, out of your face, and holds up very well.

Please be sure to give this video a BIG "üëçüèª" if you loved it, and leave a comment below telling where you will be spending the Holidays!

üíã's -Mindy
 

Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, spray bottle, 2 small hair elastics, 1 ponytail holder, hairspray and ribbon {if desired}.

videos.title: Queen of Hearts (Red Queen) | Halloween Hairstyles
videos.description:
Today we will be showing you how to get the perfect "Queen of Hearts" updo hairstyle, to go with your costume for Halloween!

To watch the rest of our Halloween Spooktorials, be sure to click HERE! http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL_SCossQygjtjdIDFVDBGJDzDn_f5uS-c
__

Ever since we watched Tim Burton's "Alice in Wonderland" in 2010, I just knew one day we would want to dress up like the Queen of Hearts! We used Helena Bonham Carter's red queen character as the inspiration.

In this tutorial, I will show you how to create and use hair padding with products you can find at your local beauty supply store. Then by following our rolling and twist technique, you can get this fun Halloween updo, too!

We found this beautiful Queen of Hearts costume/dress, among others, from the amazing Ella Dynae {http://www.etsy.com/shop/EllaDynae}

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHQueenOfHearts

Rylan was immediately who I thought of when deciding which of my girls to use for this tutorial. She really plays the character well, as you can tell from the intro shots!

Please be sure to give this video a BIG "üëçüèª" if you loved it, and leave a comment below telling us which #CGHSpooktorials tutorial has been your favorite so far, and what new ones would you love to see?

üíã's -Mindy
 

Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, spray bottle,  two hair nets, fake hair, 5 small hair elastics, 10-12 bobby pins, spray wax & hairspray {if desired}.

videos.title: The Dragon Braid | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
See fan hairstyle photos featured on our Instagram, plus more family photos by following below!
http://www.instagram.com/CuteGirlsHairstyles

Happy Easter! Our outfit links are below!  This week's hairstyle is nothing new, you've seen it around everywhere on the catwalk and in magazines. I've even seen a photo tutorial by LalasUpdos on IG, but we've never filmed a tutorial for it. 

This style is called the Dragon Braid as the Pancaked Dutch Lace Braids mimic the bumpy scales down the spine of the dragon, much like you see down the backs and tails of alligators and crocodiles today.

Brooklyn was my model today, and wears this braid on days she plans on being active. We categorize this style as "Hard" due to the overdirecting of the braid along the part lines. Once you have that down, this braid is a cinch!

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHDragonBraid

Please be sure to give this video a BIG "üëç" if you loved it, and leave a comment below letting us know your favorite part of Spring!

üíã's -Mindy
 

Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, 2 hair elastics, spray bottle, 4-6 bobby pins, hairspray or spray wax {if desired}.

Time Requirement: 10 minutes

Skill Level: Hard

videos.title: Twisted Edge Fishtail Combo | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
Thanks to everyone who attended out meet-up in Dallas yesterday, despite the icy roads! For those who couldn't attend, you can still get 20% off your purchase at http://www.ps4u.com by using coupon code "CuteHair"!
_____

We've had so many of you send in photos asking for us to make a tutorial of this Twisted Edge Fishtail hairstyle. This technique is not new, as it was inspired by my great friend at PrincessHairstyles {http://www.youtube.com/hair4myprincess}.

We loved the braid so much, that we decided to turn it into a braid combo with an option for an updo {perfect for upcoming Prom season}! 

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHTwistedEdgeFishtail

The stitching for this braid can be confusing, so pay careful attention to its pattern. Once you get it down, this braid is a cinch!

Because this braid is so tight, it is perfect for sports, cheer, dance, and the bun would be beautiful for Prom, Homecoming, ballet, gymnastics, or to dress up your day! We LOVE it!

Please be sure to give this video a BIG "üëç" if you loved it, and leave a comment below telling us what you plan to do during Spring Break! {We are going to Dubai!}

If you are reading this, comment below with a üç©!

videos.title: Scissor Waterfall Combo | Combination Hairstyles
videos.description:
Learn how to create our delicious Pumpkin Ice Cream Dessert {from a family recipe} here! http://youtu.be/6zVGLkZJbHU üéÉüç¶üç®

Can you help us get this video to 20,000 likes??? üòò
__________________________

I've noticed this cool new Scissor Waterfall Braid technique several weeks ago, and now a few Instagrammers and YouTubers have shown how to create one with fabulous tutorials.

Viriyuemoon on IG was who I learned this from, but PrincessHairstyles, FletteMaria, and HairAndNailsInspiration also have tutorials.

It is a VERY creative braid, and so many fans were tagging me, or emailing photos of this braid, asking for us to create a tutorial for it!

So, two weeks ago Kamri volunteered to model as long as I let her add a fishtail to it. I loved the idea of a combination, so we decided to incorporate the Scissor Waterfall Braid into a combo by using waves as the base, and then bringing the waterfalls back into a centered messy fishtail braid.

To see your own photo recreations featured in our app, feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle on IG with: #CGHScissorWaterfallCombo

What do you think about this hairstyle? Feel free to share this with a friend you want to create this on you!

Enjoy!

Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, spray bottle, 2 small hair elastics, hairspray {if desired}.

Time Requirement: 20-25 minutes

Skill Level: Hard

videos.description:
Be sure to watch BrooklynAndBailey's Last-Minute DIY Halloween Costume Ideas, and SUBSCRIBE to them!
http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLj0H71LavJZ9V5oKLkgddFwa1bvhdVvib

Can you help us get this video to 20,000 LIKES?
______________________________

Today's Hair Pin Curl tutorial was one we've been waiting nearly a year to show you. The curl type we use here isn't likely one you would use every day, but it is PERFECT for Halloween!!! üéÉ

We sure turned a lot of heads this weekend as we filmed the intro for this video! Bailey loved it, and really delved into character! {Shaun was pretty much embarrassed the entire time!}

You can use this technique as a base-texture hairstyle for a witch, lion, mad scientist, Bride of Frankenstein, zombie, Mad Hatter, etc!  Bailey wanted to be a Zombie Cheerleader! Pretty much anything that requires frizzy hair, even The Walking Dead!

Bailey's costume is from http://www.chasing-fireflies.com.

For this tutorial, I used hairpins to wrap the hair in a rick rack set {giving the resulting "rick rack" looking wave pattern, a classical sewing term}. I then secure the sets with bobby pins. This curling set isn't new, as it's been taught in styling schools for decades, and now several websites provide tutorials for them as well. {One of our favorites was done by the girls at thebeautydepartment.com.}

To see your own photo recreations featured in our app, feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle on IG with: #CGHHairPinCurls

To get this look, be prepared to spend about an hour setting the hair {if you are doing this by yourself}. If you have a friend helping you, this process will go much faster.

To see the rest of our #CGHSpooktorials series, click here:
http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL_SCossQygjtjdIDFVDBGJDzDn_f5uS-c

Enjoy!

Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, 40-50 hair pins, 40-50 bobby pins or alligator clips, heat protectant, flat iron, hairspray, leaves and grass {optional}.

Time Requirement: 60 minutes

Skill Level: Hard {only because of time}

To see step-by-step instructions and more photos of this style, please visit... http://www.cutegirlshairstyles.com

To see the rest of our Halloween Hairstyles, click the following link:
http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL_SCossQygjtjdIDFVDBGJDzDn_f5uS-c
_____________________________

I've wanted to film this Rosie the Riveter tutorial for a long time now, but knew that it was fitting for our Halloweeen #CGHSpooktorials series.

Rosie is a cultural icon here in the United States. She represents those women who were needed to work in industry while the men of the time were called up to serve during World War II. Because of this, and other sacrifices women made at the time, she is an icon representing feminism and economic industry.

The basic fundamentals of this hairstyle include a pin curl and a messy bun. Accented with a red bandana, this hairstyle comes fairly close to the style seen in Rosie's ever-famous "muscle" pose.

To see your own photo recreations featured in our app, feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle on IG with: #CGHRosieTheRiveter

videos.title: Rope-Twisted Pinwheel Bun | Prom Hairstyles
videos.description:
You all know that we poke fun of Brooklyn as most likely to become a librarian, not only because she loves reading so much, but because her go-to hairstyle is the Librarian Bun!

Well, Brooklyn and I began experimenting with new hair buns a few weeks ago, and decided to try micro rope twists in the bun, which ended up looking fabulous! Here is how this style came to be...

A friend of mine, Princess Hairstyles, created a Pinwheel Bun tutorial {http://youtu.be/G-SE5GiS4IA} in 2013, using single strand twists that we loved. A few of our viewers experimented with it in combination with our Love Bun this past Valentine's Day.

We wanted to create a bun that had even more texture, in a duplicating pattern, that will certainly be a highlight of any hairstyle combination you use. We imagine this Rope-Twisted Pinwheel Bun being a personal favorite for formal dances such as Prom, Homecoming, etc, or for events such as graduations or weddings.

Tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHRopePinwheelBun

It doesn't have to stop there... the bun can be perfect for sports, gymnastics, cheer, ballet, etc, because the bun holds up so well with lots of activity.  Brooklyn wore this bun for two days straight, and hardly needed any time to spruce it up the second day!

Enjoy!

xoxo
-Mindy

Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, spray bottle, 1 ponytail holder, 1 bun maker {matching color of hair}, 4-6 bobby pins, hairspray and accessory {if desired}.

Time Requirement: 15-20 minutes

Skill Level: Hard {because of time}

videos.title: Zipper Braid Updo | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
Click to view our BONUS video: http://youtu.be/TARNXGSEbME {Anna's Coronation Hairstyle from Disney's Frozen}

* ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ * 

Tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHZipperBraid

See more photos and written step-by-step instructions for this hairstyle at:
http://www.cutegirlshairstyles.com/?p=7061

Today's Zipper Braid is very tricky, not a new technique, but the stranding does take a little mental exercise to get down. Because the first few stitches are the ABSOLUTE hardest, we decided to film a tutorial for you and try and make it as clear as we can. {CGH3 volunteered to be my model.}

There are a few nice photos of this braid technique floating around on Pinterest and Instagram, so this isn't new but a braid. {I first saw it on a Spanish tutorial by Diana Rojas on YouTube, back in July, 2013.} What we can say, is that this braid does draw a lot of attention, especially when worn in a combo!

We imagine this as being a perfect updo hairstyle for a Prom, Homecoming, or any other formal. YOU... ARE... GONNA... LOVE... IT!

My first big tip is to wet down the hair before braiding. For braids that involve multiples of strands, we find that this helps the braid look more clean and crisp.

As you braid, you may find a few "sharks" {parts where the hair sticks up like a shark fin in water} will appear.  Simply comb them towards the braid and tuck them under it, to help hide them.

CGH3 has worn this a few times now, and the girls at her school were taking photos of them on their phones.  The photos spread to older sisters who then showed my twins at their Junior High.  They thought it was funny how fast it spread!

Enjoy!

Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, spray bottle, 1 hairband, 3-5 bobby pins, hairspray {if desired}.

Time Requirement: 8-10 minutes

Skill Level: Hard

To see step-by-step instructions and more photos of this style, please visit...
http://www.cutegirlshairstyles.com

videos.title: Waterfall into Double Frenchbacks | Sport Hairstyles
videos.description:
Tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHWaterDoubleFrench

If you have seen our Soccer Braids tutorial, I need to let you know that was my go-to hairstyle when I was a young girl.  For each of my girls, that is the very style we use when they are participating in sports because the hair held up well with all the activity.

Today, I wanted to dig into my past by taking that style and "spicing" it up a bit.  

Rather than adding another Frenchback down the middle, I opted to create a double-sided Waterfall Braid down the center of the head.  I then incorporated those fall-through strands as the added-in hair for the topside of each Frenchback.  It turned out super cute, and leaves a very intricate pattern that I am sure people will notice!

Enjoy!

Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, spray bottle, 2 small hair elastics, accessory or hairspray {if desired}.

Time Requirement: 8-10 minutes

Skill Level: Medium

videos.description:
Don't forget to follow CGH and BrooklynAndBailey on Instagram to see more behind-the-scenes photos!

http://www.instagram.com/CuteGirlsHairstyles

A few months ago we showed you how to create the Stacked Braid, and it has been very popular!  Click here to see that tutorial...  http://youtu.be/eRx2UjRjYDw

At the same time, we tried stacking the base braid with a rope braid twist on top and it is equally as cute!  You simply use the same technique in stacking the twist, only that you only pull out strands from the inside of the right most strand as you go down {to later incorporate in your stacked twist} rather than strands from both sides as in the stacked braids.  The video will make this clear.

My girls have worn this for several months and it gets just as many compliments as the Stacked Braids, only people are more curious at how the twist stays on top!  Try it, and see what your friends think!

Enjoy!

videos.description:
Don't forget to subscribe to Brooklyn and Bailey's channel...
http://bit.ly/SubscribeBrooklynAndBailey

Tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHWindingLaceBraid

You all know that we LOVE lace braids in our home.   A fan emailed us the lace braid ponytail photo from Pinterest over a year ago and we filmed a tutorial on CGH#3 at that time.  I didn't like the lighting, since we were working on a new camera back then.  So, we re-filmed it the week before we moved, and here it is!  I like it much better!

Brooklyn and I show you the "cheat" in this hairstyle in that you do not actually Lace Braid all the way down the ponytail.  Every time the braid wraps under the ponytail, I just did 3-4 stitches of a regular braid and then wrapped it around, picking back up with the Lace Braid on the side.  You can't tell and it makes the braid much easier to do!

Enjoy!


Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, spray bottle, 2 bobby pins, 1 large hair band, 1 small hair elastic, hairspray {if desired}.

videos.description:

I have seen the mermaid braid on Pinterest a lot lately, and on Instagram, but to be honest... I never really liked how it looks on its own.  That is why we have not filmed a tutorial for it.

Thinking about it for some weeks now, I thought the style would look better if the strands added in were not just from the front shoulder hair.  Then it hit me, why not make a combo using the Waterfall Twists as a base for the hairstyle... and then use the falling strands as the add-ins for the Mermaid Braid!  When I tried it out, I LOVED IT!

CGH#3 wanted to be my model, knowing that today is Mother's Day, and asked to do the introduction!  Isn't she adorable???

Hope you love this hairstyle as much as I do, and if you do... please feel free to share!

videos.title: Wrap-Around Prim Braid | Catching Fire | Hunger Games Hairstyles
videos.description:
To read about our son's adoption story, please click here:  http://www.cutegirlshairstyles.com/adoption/our-adoption-story

It looks like Lionsgate has released a photo still from the Hunger Games sequel "Catching Fire", showing Prim embracing Katniss right after her sister returns home from the games.

The photo shows a good side shot of a super cute braid that Prim is wearing!  It looks like a variation of the Katniss braid, but with some hair down in the back.

Taking a quick look at the photo, we could tell that it was a winding braid, using a lace braid along the partline and forehead. Then, right about the right temple, the braid turns into a Dutch braid until just behind the right ear, then back into a lace braid diagonally around the back {allowing for hair down}.  The braid is then finished into a simple braid that can be worn down in the back or over the shoulder.

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHWrapAroundPrimBraid

For another super-cute look, you could continue the diagonal braid as a Dutch braid instead of a lace braid... giving your a beautiful variation of the Katniss braid from the original movie and Catching Fire!  

If you would like us to do more "Catching Fire" hairstyles, simply let us know in the comment box below!  And... if you loved this tutorial, PLEASE BE SURE TO SHARE IT!

Enjoy!

Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, curling wand, 1 small hair elastic, hairspray {if desired}.

Time Requirement: 5 minutes without texture, 10-12 minutes with curls added.

Skill Level: Hard

To see step-by-step instructions and more photos of this style, please visit...

videos.title: Feather Waterfall & Ladder Braid Combo | Cute 2-in-1 Hairstyles
videos.description:
You all have seen our Ladder Braid Ponytail video we uploaded two weeks ago, and may have noticed that it was one of our more popular of recent videos.

We wanted to create something even better, using similar braid techniques!  Today, we show you two gorgeous hairstyles in one video!  First, the Feather Waterfall Braid and, second, the Ladder Braid Combo.

For the Feather Waterfall Braid, I combine stitches using both a Lace Braid and a Feather Braid!  The result is breathtaking!

For the Ladder Braid combo, I use the finished Feather Waterfall Braid and then create another Lace Braid below the original pulling in the feather strands to create there rungs of the Ladder Braid.

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHLadderBraidCombo

CGH#3 wore the latter to the Kid History {http://www.youtube.com/BoredShortsTV} Episode #10 premier this past Friday night... and the fans LOVED it!

Enjoy!

Skill Level: Medium

videos.title: Cocoon Curls | Easy No-Heat Curls | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
Be sure to check out Intermountain Moms on Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/intermountainmoms/app_197602066931325

Nurse Dani at IntermountainMoms was able to help me this last week know when we should take CGH#1 to the doctor after she fractured her wrist during gymnastics... she saved me approx $150 for an x-ray that would have been too early to tell! {It is fractured, BTW. *sad*} They are also giving away a ton of stuff every day, so I, of course, entered the giveaway!

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHCocoonCurls

This week's hairstyle is sure to be a popular one, since so many women, moms, and teen girls are reluctant to use too much heat in their hair.  The challenge with no heat, is how do you obtain gorgeous curls without heat?

Well, we have already shown you how to create No-Heat Headband Curls:
http://youtu.be/0Rdfgu3zqY4

And we have shown you how to create No-Heat Sock Curls:
http://youtu.be/CzJKdHglFck

...but here we show you a very interesting, yet easy way to get voluminous curls without heat!  It uses a technique we call "Cocooning," yes, cocooning as in a caterpillar turning into a butterfly!  {We originally learned this curl from http://www.youtube.com/beautyklove, so be sure to check her out.}

This technique only provides the curl on the bottom half of the hair, so I find that a headband or hat is the perfect accessory for this hairstyle!  The curls also last for a few days, so you can combine these curls as a 2nd or 3rd day 'do using any of our accent braids, twists, etc!

Enjoy!

Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, spray bottle, bandana, hairspray {if desired}.

Time Requirement: 15-20 minutes

If you know how to do the first step of tying your shoe, you can do this braid!  It is created with essentially overlapping square knots.  I start with the hair wet, and use a little pomade... when the hair dries, the loops of the knots spread a little and look gorgeous!  

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHKnottedHeadband

This braid is perfect for dancers, cheerleaders, or just wearing around town or with a combo for a dance or formal occasion!  It is also great for women of all ages!  We have worn this on my #4 daughter with short hair, and is a braid you can do on yourself as well!  I guarantee you will certainly receive lots of compliments on this hairstyle!

Enjoy!

videos.description:
To see more photos of this style, please visit...
http://www.cutegirlshairstyles.com

Want to become a "Super Fan" of the week, and potentially have your photo appear in a future video?  Simply email us a photo of you doing something crazy or fun while wearing a CGH t-shirt!  Grab our gear here...

http://www.twitter.com/CuteGirlHair
http://www.pinterest.com/MrsHairdo
http://www.instagram.com/CuteGirlsHairstyles

* ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ *

A fan of ours emailed us a photo of this hairstyle the other day, and I thought the idea was so fun and unique!  It was probably the most unique and cute hairstyle I have seen since the Waterfall Braid! So... I sat down to figure it out, but after many attempts I wasn't having any luck.  

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHBowBraid

As another fan knew I was looking into the braid technique, she posted a picture on our Facebook page with a link to a Russian YouTube video showing the exact technique. The video is not very good quality and at times difficult to follow, but it gave me just enough information to be able to master the braid!  Now it is time to share with you all everything I learned!

There are endless possibilities with this bow braid hairstyle... short hair, medium hair, long hair, layered hair, hair with bangs, combos, etc.  I show you in the video finished hairstyles using the bow braid and adapting it to a braided headband, diagonal braid, lace braid, or even ponytails.  Any style that contains a regular 3 strand French braid could be transformed with bows to become "The Bow Braid" version!!!  {What a unique and super cute way to spice up a traditional French Braid!}  

Items Needed:  A brush, rat-tail comb, spray bottle, hairspray or pomade, a hairpin (not a bobby pin), and a few hair elastics.

Time Requirement:  10-15 minutes, depending on the hairstyle you choose.

In the video you see that I mixed in the tails of the bows back into the next strand.  You may find it easier and less "messy" to simply lay the tail alongside the French Braid and then bring down the next section of hair for the next loop.  As you finish the braid, most of the tails will be covered by the hair from the top.  It all depends on how you want the bow braid to look.

Enjoy!

videos.description:

http://www.pinterest.com/MrsHairdo
http://www.instagram/CuteGirlsHairstyles

* ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ *

Items Needed: Brush, one hair elastic, 3-4 Goody Spin Pins {if not, then 6-7 bobby pins}, curling iron {for pre-braid texture}, hairspray {if desired}.

Time Requirement:  5+ minutes

I love the way that fishtail braids look, and have been wanting to a Fishtail braided bun for a long time!  Since this is prom season, we decided to finally film this hairstyle for all of you.

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHSideFishtailBun

If you do not know how to fishtail braid, please see our easy step-by-step video here first...
http://tinyurl.com/howtofishtail

Before the tutorial, I slightly curled the top layer of the hair only, using a curling wand, leaving the underneath layers as is.  I then gathered all of the hair to the side by the right ear and created the fishtail braid.

Once the braid was finished, I secured it with the hair elastic and tugged on the sides of the braid just to make the braid appear more loose.  Then I rolled the braid up into a bun and pinned it just behind the ear.  

To avoid having to use so many bobby pins, I used 3 Goody Spin Pins.  These pins are the perfect solution for holding hair buns together all day!  I figure that each spin pin saves you from having to use 2-3 bobby pins, and they come in colors to match your hair type.  If you would like to purchase Goody Spin Pins, you can find them at Wal-Mart, Target, Sally's, etc.  You can also find them on Amazon here... 

http://amzn.to/1Tck00N

This braided updo hairstyle is perfect for prom, homecoming, weddings, or on days when you simply want to wear a very unique, but cute, hair bun! I think it turned out very cute!

Enjoy!

FTC Disclosure:  This is not a paid review of the Goody¬Æ Spin Pin.  I purchased these myself and use them in my hair bun tutorials.  All opinions of the product are strictly mine, and results may vary.

I am a BIG fan of messy braids, and now they are so popular... so we decided to give you a 5-Strand Messy Braid tutorial!

The stranding for this braid is a little complex, since you are using five strands instead of three, but once you get the hang of it - the braid will take very little time to create.

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHMessy5StrandBraid

If you do not know how to braid with 5 strands, make sure you are comfortable with a 3-strand braid first.  You can see our 3-Strand Messy Braid tutorial here...

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QS7U-rZiub4

Watch carefully to see how we incorporate the other two strands, then, as we finish, we tie off the braid and then loosen the "elbows" of the braid.

When I walk around with this braided hairstyle, I receive so many compliments because it does not look like a regular braid.  Other girls want to know exactly how I did it.  I know you will get compliments, too!  

Items Needed: Brush, comb, ponytail holder, hairspray {if desired}

Time Required: 5 minutes

Hope you enjoy!

* ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ *

There are various tutorials out there that teach how to do the crown braid, but this one is intended to be one of the most clean and crisp.  Some variations use a ponytail on top from which you pull strands into the crown braid.  I do not particularly like that version as it leave a hole on the top of the head, and a bump as well.

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHCrownBraid

The Crown Braid uses the Dutch Braiding technique, but you pull the hair in on top only from the front.  This is what makes the style look so clean, and allows for the braid to pop out.  This style is perfect for formal occasions, prom, homecoming, graduation, baptism, communion, weddings, etc.  It is particularly great for cheer, gymnastics, ballet, and other sports.  Enjoy!

Please don't forget to join our Facebook fan page at...
